articles.content:
Congratulations to Austrian President
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on May 4 sent a congratulatory message to Heinz Fischer upon his election as federal president of the Republic of Austria.
 Expressing the hope and belief that the president would as ever make positive efforts for the development of the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries as an intimate friend of the Korean people, the message sincerely wished him health and happiness and great successes in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and the well-being of the Austrian people.

articles.content:
Congratulations to Macedonian President
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on May 5 sent a congratulatory message to Branko Crvenkovski upon his election as president of the Republic of Macedonia.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.content:
Orchestra of DPRK Leaves for Germany
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Yun I Sang Orchestra Band Left here on Thursday to visit Germany.
 The band was seen off at Pyongyang Railway Station by Sim Tong Gol, vice-minister of Culture, officials concerned, artistes and the bereaved family of Yun I Sang.

articles.title: Unconditional Release of Ex-Chief Secretary of Chongwadae Called for
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Delegation of European Regional Office of WFTU
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Secretary Choe Thae Bok of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Thursday met and had a friendly conversation with a delegation of the European Regional Office of the World Federation of Trade Unions led by Coordinator Georgios Mavrikos at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
 On hand was Vice-Chairman Kim Yong Do of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea.    
 The head of the delegation said that during their stay in Korea they witnessed the successes gained by the Korean people in their efforts for the prosperity of the country under the wise guidance of the WPK. They will express full support and solidarity with the struggle of the Korean people who are vigorously advancing in the face of the U.S. moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK, he added.
